value.title: Marketers: Make Artificial Intelligence Reflect Your Values — Not Undermine Them
value.excerpt: A few measures can help reduce the risks and raise the odds that AI can help you strengthen and better communicate your values.

value.title: Healthcare Revolution In The Platform Economy
value.excerpt: If there is any industry worthy of platform innovation and disruption, it’s the healthcare industry. Advancements in inpatient care, unit productivity and service accessibility can be the difference between life and death.

value.title: Deep learning-based splice-AI can help predict the onset of Alzheimer's disease
value.excerpt: Korea Brain Research Institute (KBRI, President Suh Pann-ghill) announced that the research team led by Dr. Jae-Yeol Joo discovered new cryptic splice variants and SNVs in PLCg1 gene of AD-specific models for the first time using Splice-AI.

value.title: Most ads you see are chosen by a reinforcement learning model — here’s how it works
value.excerpt: Every day, digital advertisement agencies serve billions of ads on news websites, search engines, social media networks, video streaming websites, and other platforms. And they all want to answer the same question: Which of the many ads they have in their catalog is more likely to appeal to a certain viewer?

value.title: Artificial Intelligence In Healthcare Market Leading Companies Capabilities, Goals and Strategies During 2020
value.excerpt: A comprehensive research report created through extensive primary research (inputs from industry experts, companies, stakeholders) and secondary research, the report aims to present the analysis of Global Artificial Intelligence in Healthcare Market.

value.title: Google’s deep learning finds a critical path in AI chips
value.excerpt: ZDNet spoke with Google Brain director Jeff Dean about how the company is using artificial intelligence to advance its internal development of custom chips to accelerate its software. Dean noted that deep learning forms of artificial intelligence can in some cases make better decisions than humans about how to lay out circuitry in a chip.

value.title: How COVID-19 Broke AI, And Why AI May Break Again
value.excerpt: The unprecedented circumstances caused by COVID-19 caused many AIs to break. How did these AIs break and what can your business do to ensure that future AIs do not suffer from the same vulnerabilities?

value.title: Americans Want Self-Driving Cars, But Want Safety First
value.excerpt: Americans are not known for prioritizing road safety. No state currently bans all cell use phone behind the wheel, and two states still allow drivers to text. And the United States consistently lags behind other developed nations,

value.title: GPT-3: We’re at the very beginning of a new app ecosystem
value.excerpt: The NLP application ecosystem is in its earliest stages, and it's not yet clear whether GPT-3 or a different model will be the foundation.

value.title: AI Tool “Deep Nostalgia” Lets You Reanimate Your Dead Relatives
value.excerpt: The genealogy platform MyHeritage has introduced a new tool called Deep Nostalgia that allows you to animate old photos of dead relatives.

value.title: Zorroa Launches Boon AI; No-code Machine Learning for Media-driven Organizations
value.excerpt: Zorroa Corp., a leading provider of accessible machine learning (ML) integration solutions backed by Gradient Ventures, Google’s AI-focused venture fund, today officially launched a first-of-its-kind ML SaaS platform,

value.title: COMMENTARY: How robotics are changing jobs in Canada
value.excerpt: One widely cited study estimates that 47 per cent of jobs in the United States are at risk of being replaced by robots and artificial intelligence. Read more: The 5-minute shopping spree.

value.title: Researchers are developing 3D structural-sensing robots to handle healthcare tasks
value.excerpt: Robots that could take on basic healthcare tasks to support the work of doctors and nurses may be the way of the future. Who knows, maybe a medical robot can prescribe your medicine someday? That's the idea behind 3D structural-sensing robots being developed and tested at Simon Fraser University by Woo Soo Kim,

value.title: How One State Managed to Actually Write Rules on Facial Recognition
value.excerpt: Massachusetts is one of the first states to put legislative guardrails around the use of facial recognition technology in criminal investigations.

value.title: The company using robots and fan input to pitch stories to Hollywood
value.excerpt: Wattpad, a social storytelling platform with 90 million users, is becoming a rich source of intellectual property for film and TV producers.

value.title: The Deep South Has a Rich History of Resistance, as Amazon Is Learning
value.excerpt: The Deep South is not generally known for its labor agitation, which is why it might come as a surprise for some to learn that it is in Alabama where workers have mounted one of the largest and most aggressive efforts to unionize Amazon in recent memory.

value.title: GCHQ outlines how it’s going to ensure its (secretive) use of AI is ethical

value.title: How Google's Grand Plan to Make Its Own Games Fell Apart
value.excerpt: The tech giant hired 150 game developers for Stadia Games and Entertainment, only to lay them all off. Sources say it never gave the studios a chance.

value.title: IBM Watson: Why Is Healthcare AI So Tough?
value.excerpt: A pivotal event for AI happened when IBM’s Watson beat two all-time champions of Jeopardy! in 2011. This showed that the technology was far from being experimental. IBM would soon go on to make Watson the centerpiece of its AI strategy. And a big part of ...

value.title: TensorFlow: A cheat sheet
value.excerpt: TensorFlow is an open source software library developed by Google for numerical computation with data flow graphs. This TensorFlow guide covers why the library matters, how to use it, and more.

value.title: AI Weekly: Biden calls for $37 billion to address chip shortage
value.excerpt: President Biden this week signed a supply chain executive order and pledged support for $37 billion to address a semiconductor shortage.

value.title: MyHeritage’s new AI tool turns photos of the dead into unnerving videos
value.excerpt: Genealogy site MyHeritage has released an AI tool called DeepNostalgia that turns photos of deceased relatives into creepy videos.

value.title: Driverless bus hits streets in southern Spain
value.excerpt: A new driverless electric bus has begun operating in the southern Spanish city of Malaga, in a project presented as a first in Europe.

value.title: Fast-food drive-thrus are getting smarter. Here's how
value.excerpt: Drive-thrus are a lead generator of fast-food sales during the pandemic, and many chains, like McDonald's are trying to speed up the process by deploying new tech, including artificial intelligence for ordering.

value.title: AI conquers challenge of 1980s platform games
value.excerpt: Scientists have come up with a computer program that can master a variety of 1980s exploration games, paving the way for more self-sufficient robots. They created a family of algorithms (software-based instructions for solving a problem) able to complete classic Atari games,
